intro: Eremalche parryi subsp. parryi, commonly known as Parry's eremalche, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small yellow to orange flowers. It is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
